title: geth 1.10.8 stop sync
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth-linux-amd64-1.10.8-26675454`
OS & Version: Linux, mem:15g(7.8g left), disk:1.4T(900g left)

````
--maxpeers 70 --cache 1024 --txpool.globalslots 1024 --syncmode fast -rpcapi debug,txpool,admin,net,personal,eth,web3 --rpc
````

#### Actual behaviour
````
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 13178787,
  highestBlock: 13182182,
  knownStates: 862497244,
  pulledStates: 862497244,
  startingBlock: 13178786
}
````

#### Backtrace

````
ERROR[09-08|09:43:50.097] 
########## BAD BLOCK #########
Chain config: {ChainID: 1 Homestead: 1150000 DAO: 1920000 DAOSupport: true EIP150: 2463000 EIP155: 2675000 EIP158: 2675000 Byzantium: 4370000 Constantinople: 7280000 Petersburg: 7280000 Istanbul: 9069000, Muir Glacier: 9200000, Berlin: 12244000, London: 12965000, Engine: ethash}

Number: 13178788
Hash: 0x508eeced0dea430210f378913ca1cfe616024a22c08f05e211df92bd0dd8c6be


Error: could not apply tx 364 [0x1d065e10d9a2da515cc1f5fdc5a7bac2d359143be446fffa67147eefcb416d8a]: gas limit reached
##############################
 
WARN [09-08|09:43:50.137] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=7d0bd2d3f7ac769460a7bd55d83ed66d2bd10b5980dc68fe7c04a48be605277e err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: could not apply tx 364 [0x1d065e10d9a2da515cc1f5fdc5a7bac2d359143be446fffa67147eefcb416d8a]: gas limit reached"
WARN [09-08|09:43:50.138] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="peer is unknown or unhealthy"
INFO [09-08|09:43:51.883] Generating state snapshot                root=2eb66e..89d2fc at=c718c6..4cf5f3 accounts=112,739,094 slots=395,334,488 storage=33.41GiB   elapsed=105h14m58.528s eta=30h4m51.785s
INFO [09-08|09:43:59.883] Generating state snapshot                root=2eb66e..89d2fc in=c71a83..5ec5e9 at=11d855..bd8506 accounts=112,743,105 slots=395,341,671 storage=33.41GiB   elapsed=105h15m6.528s  eta=30h4m37.447s
WARN [09-08|09:44:07.114] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=97d418327f8627fb801abeed609c0c9464cf95ed76670d027c884eb697685f86 err=timeout
WARN [09-08|09:44:07.114] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="peer is unknown or unhealthy"
INFO [09-08|09:44:07.883] Generating state snapshot                root=2eb66e..89d2fc in=c71a83..5ec5e9 at=31bd8b..80a1c9 accounts=112,743,105 slots=395,352,612 storage=33.41GiB   elapsed=105h15m14.529s eta=30h4m39.734s
INFO [09-08|09:44:15.884] Generating state snapshot                root=2eb66e..89d2fc in=c71a83..5ec5e9 at=519b0d..11a2da accounts=112,743,105 slots=395,363,393 storage=33.41GiB   elapsed=105h15m22.529s eta=30h4m42.02s
INFO [09-08|09:44:23.885] Generating state snapshot                root=2eb66e..89d2fc in=c71a83..5ec5e9 at=722e01..e97b43 accounts=112,743,105 slots=395,374,280 storage=33.42GiB   elapsed=105h15m30.530s eta=30h4m44.306s
WARN [09-08|09:44:27.902] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=fc125e693e8df9d630d4c94e7d73f74089d5a524789afee8d15a5c1342f0d43d err=timeout
WARN [09-08|09:44:27.902] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="peer is unknown or unhealthy"
````
I am getting the same issue
@ligi I haven clean all my chaindata, what else should I clean?

I also noticed you are providing the incorrect hash for the whitelist @CircuitBreaker88 . Assuming the Etherscan is correct you should pass `--whitelist 10920274=0xfd652086d220d506ae5b7cb80fde97d2f3f7028d346cc7d9d384a83d3d638532`. Interesting that we both fork at the same block but not at [10679538](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/master/network-upgrades/retrospectives/london.md) where issue came up.

Other issues reporting split at the same block `10920274`

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/23503
Got it, trying sync once more will report results

> trying sync once more will report results

It's been a month, I'll assume this was resolved
